summary: Anastas Mikoyan was a Soviet official who engaged in talks with U.S. President Lyndon B. Johnson and Secretary of State Dean Rusk following President Kennedy's assassination. These discussions, detailed in an Italian report, focused on assuring continued peaceful relations between the Soviet Union and the United States, as well as exploring disarmament and nuclear arms limitations. While the documents do not directly implicate Mikoyan in the JFK assassination, they highlight his role in post-assassination diplomatic efforts to maintain stability between the two superpowers.
significance: Anastas Mikoyan's significance in the JFK context lies in his role as a Soviet official involved in post-assassination talks with U.S. leaders to ensure continued peaceful relations and discuss disarmament, reflecting the geopolitical climate following Kennedy's death.
